definition: to have attained the Way/(of a government or a ruler) enlightened/wise and just
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
to make sense/reasonable
lit. there are principles behind making money (idiom); fig. to have a knack for good business/knowing how to accumulate wealth/good at feathering one's own nest
as they say, .../as the saying goes, ...

sentences.english: Mark came unhinged when he noticed a scratch on his new car.
sentences.chinese: 馬克發現他的車子有道刮痕時就抓狂了。

sentences.english: From the corner of his eyes, Jack saw a flash outside the window. Hensley saw it, too.
sentences.chinese: 傑克眼角的餘光瞥到窗外有道閃光，漢斯萊也看見了。

sentences.english: There was a fence between the big brook and the school, a well of school nearby the fence.
sentences.chinese: 大溪和學校之間有道籬笆，學校的水井就在籬笆邊上。

sentences.english: Be affirmative with unerring intuition for his booming business tactics.
sentences.chinese: 慧眼識人，知人善任，經營有道，生意興隆。

sentences.english: He has a deep scratch on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他臉上有道深深的抓痕。

sentences.english: With t'ao(way), causes and conditions help you overcome ignorance to realize your Buddha nature.
sentences.chinese: 只要有道，當因緣聚會，就能照破無明，見自本性。

sentences.english: They also report that a fence now separates their neighborhood from the railroad track.
sentences.chinese: 他們還說，現在有道柵欄把他們的街坊與鐵軌隔開了。

definition: to do things right/to use the correct method
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
such matters/things like this/this line of work/this pursuit/this hobby/this endeavor
to achieve the Dao/to become an immortal
Master/(old form of address for teachers, scholars)/pedant
to stand up/to conduct oneself
nobleman/person of noble character
Wuwei county in Chaohu 巢湖[Chao2 hu2], Anhui
the Daoist doctrine of inaction/let things take their own course/laissez-faire
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
great person of the past/venerable forebear/the great and the good
idiot/ignorant fool
how? (emphatic question)
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
-ism/only/alone
yes
that being the case/then/in that case
broad and extensive (of knowledge etc)
